question: Question_A_05
statement:
Consider

\begin{align*}M = \begin{bmatrix}  1 & 7 & 3 \\ 0 & p & 5 \\ 1 & pq + 7 & 8 \end{bmatrix}\end{align*}

Choose \emph{p} and \emph{q} such that \emph{M} have rank 2. Give an
example of a vector \emph{b} for which the linear system $Mx = b$ has no
solution.
sols:
As calculated in
\href{Science:Math_Exam_Resources/Courses/MATH152/April_2013/Question_A_04}{A04},
we take $\displaystyle q=1, p=0$,

\begin{align*}M = \begin{pmatrix}1 & 7 & 3 \\ 0 & 0 & 5 \\ 1 & 7 & 8 \end{pmatrix}.\end{align*}

Since $\displaystyle M$ has rank 2, the columns in $\displaystyle M$
must be linear dependent. We see that the second column is 7 times the
first column. Hence, the second column is redundant.

The first and the third column of $\displaystyle M$ are linearly
independent since the third one has a 5 as second entry, where the first
one has a 0. Therefore, there is no possible scalar such that columns 1
and 3 are multiples.

\begin{align*}\displaystyle Mx = b\end{align*} is only solvable, if $\displaystyle b$ is a
linear combination of the columns of $\displaystyle M$.

We want to find a vector, which is not a linear combination of the two
linear independent columns. Once possible choice is to find a vector
which orthogonal (and hence linear independent) to the first and third
column by performing the cross product,

\begin{align*}b = \begin{pmatrix}1\\0\\1\end{pmatrix} \times\begin{pmatrix}3\\5\\8\end{pmatrix} = \begin{pmatrix} -5 \\ -5 \\ 5\end{pmatrix}.\end{align*}

Note that there are several choices that could be made and this method
is just a quick and effective way for finding a suitable vector.
hints:
Since $\displaystyle M$ has rank 2, the columns in $\displaystyle M$
must be linear dependent. Which column in $\displaystyle M$ is
redundant, which two columns are linearly independent?

$\displaystyle Mx = b$ is only solvable if $\displaystyle b$ is a linear
combination of the columns of $\displaystyle M$. How do you find a
vector, which is not a linear combination of the two linear independent
columns?
